content.raw:
Do we expect parts starting with `/` to be pushed? I don't think it makes much sense to store parts containing slashes, I tried this test for example:

~~~
   URIPath path7;
   path7.PushFront("/abs");
   EXPECT_EQ(path7.Str(), "/abs");
 
   path7.PushFront("/abs2");
   EXPECT_EQ(path7.Str(), "/abs2/abs");
~~~

Resulting in

~~~
/mnt/TERA/code/ign-common/src/URI_TEST.cc:70: Failure
Value of: "/abs"
Expected: path7.Str()
Which is: "//abs"
/mnt/TERA/code/ign-common/src/URI_TEST.cc:73: Failure
Value of: "/abs2/abs"
Expected: path7.Str()
Which is: "//abs2//abs"
~~~
content.html:

   URIPath path7;
   path7.PushFront("/abs");
   EXPECT_EQ(path7.Str(), "/abs");

   path7.PushFront("/abs2");
   EXPECT_EQ(path7.Str(), "/abs2/abs");

Resulting in

Expected: path7.Str()
